column4: EvilGrin https://wiki.ubuntu.com/NetworkPrintingFromWinXP?action=show&redirect=NetworkPrintingFromWindows
he isn't printing from windows.
did you restart cups after making the change?
yes
I also made sure my firewall was shut off just so it wouldn't get in the way for this
can you ssh to the machine or some other kind of connection?
yes.  Using VNC I can connect to localhost:631 on the server...but nobody else can connect to 192.168.1.3:631 (the server's IP)
can you pastebin the Allow lines you have in your cupsd.conf
pasted under my nick
you realized that # comments out the line?
yes
I added a lot of extra lines...what I did is closer to the bottom
you don't have a <Location> section
you need to add the Allow lines inside the <Location> tags near the top
yeah
still no luck.  Under <Location /> I added Allow From 192.168.1.5 (machine I'm trying to connect from..still nothing.  Won't connect to anything on port 631
then I'm out of ideas
me too.
thanks anyway
were you following the wiki page?
no, I installed cups and used the web interface to add some printers and then added those Allow From lines...didnt know there was a wiki.  let me check that out.
search the wiki for network printing, they have guides
works now :-D
